
## Images and Layers
* image layer v.s container layer
    * image layer
        * read-only
        * each upper layer is a copy of 1 level lower layer plus the difference
    * container layer
        * read and write

## Container and image layers
* multiple containers can be produced from same image


## Running Container Size on Disk
* size: size of container layer
* virtual size: size of image

* example
    * multiple containers generated by single image
        * total size: n sizes + 1 virtual size
    * n containers generated by m images
        * total size: n sizes + (x different image layer sizes + y common image layer sizes)
            * (x different image layer sizes + y common image layer sizes) smaller than size of m images

## copy on write
* when the system create each image layer it will copy all data from layer that is 1 level blow it to the current layer
